Japan's Moves to Grab Tok Islet Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Japan's Moves to Grab Tok Islet Denounced in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations in south Korea including the Reunification Solidarity, the All-people Committee for the Proper Liquidation of the Past, the Solidarity for Asian Peace and Education in History and the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers' Corps reportedly held a press conference in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul on April 20 to denounce Japan's moves to grab Tok Islet.
 A press release distributed at the conference accused Japan of desperately working to grab Tok Islet although it is a hard fact proved by history that the islet is an inalienable part of the territory of Korea.    
 Noting that Japan's moves to grab the islet is a continuation of its plot to revive militarism, the press release said that Japan is keen to instill militarism and the ambition for territorial expansion into the younger generation through the institution of "Day of Takeshima (Tok Islet)," visits to the "Yasukuni Shrine" and the compilation of the distorted history textbooks justifying its past wars of aggression.
 The civic and public organizations will never tolerate Japan's moves to grab Tok Islet, the press release noted, urging the "government" to strongly react to Japan's provocative moves to illegally seize the islet.

Greetings to South African President
articles.content:
Greetings to South African President
     Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on April  22 sent a message of greetings to Thabo Mbuyelwa Mbeki, president of the Republic of South Africa, on the occasion of its national day.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would be expanded and developed in mutual interests and wished the South African president and people greater successes in their work for the social and economic stability and progress of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Sierra Leonean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Sierra Leonean President
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on April 22 sent a message of greetings to Al Haji Ahmad Tejan Kabbah, president of Sierra Leone, on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of its independence.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the Sierra Leonean president greater success in his work for the peace, stability and socio-economic development of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Togolese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Togolese President
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on April 21 sent a message of greetings to Faure Gnassingbe, president of Togo, on the occasion of the 46th anniversary of its independence.
 The message wholeheartedly wished the Togolese president great success in his work for the peace and prosperity of the country, expressing the belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to grow stronger.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Venezuelan Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Venezuelan Ambassador
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Ambassador of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela to the DPRK Rocio Maneiro Gonzalez at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
 On hand were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Hyong Jun and staff members of the Venezuelan embassy here.    
 After receiving the credentials, Kim Yong Nam had a conversation with the ambassador.
